descriptors.defaultMessage: Your first step is to pick some assessments that will allow you to evaluate the criteria you've selected for your job poster. Below you'll find your essential criteria, followed by your asset criteria if you've selected any. The builder will save as you go, so when you're finished, feel free to move to step 2 to review your work.

descriptors.defaultMessage: Try for a casual, frank, friendly tone...
How our team makes an impact:
descriptors.description: Header of Job Poster Builder Team Impact Section

descriptors.defaultMessage:
Describe the value your team/service/initiative brings to Canadians.
              It doesn’t matter if your work is direct to citizens or back office,
              innovative or maintenance, top priority or ongoing. Describe how it
              contributes to making Canada better the way you would to someone who
              knows nothing about your work.
descriptors.description: Body of Job Poster Builder Team Impact Section
Flag text for empty required field
Flag text for validation error

descriptors.defaultMessage: How the new hire makes an impact:
descriptors.description: Header of Job Poster Builder Hire Impact Section

descriptors.defaultMessage:
Describe how the new hire will contribute in this role. Focus on the
              value they’ll bring, not on specific tasks (you’ll provide these
              later on). For example “In this role, you’ll contribute to…” or, “As
              a member of this team, you’ll be responsible for helping us…”
descriptors.description: Body of Job Poster Builder Hire Impact Section
Button text Next

descriptors.defaultMessage: The Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat provides advice and makes recommendations on how the government spends money, how it regulates and how it is managed ensuring tax dollars are spent wisely and effectively for Canadians.
descriptors.description: Department Impact Statement of Treasury Board

descriptors.defaultMessage: Natural Resources Canada seeks to enhance the responsible development and use of Canada’s natural resources and the competitiveness of Canada’s natural resources products.
descriptors.description: Department Impact Statement of Natural Resources

descriptors.defaultMessage: Transport Canada works to serve the public interest through the promotion of a safe and secure, efficient and environmentally responsible transportation system in Canada.
descriptors.description: Department Impact Statement of Transport

descriptors.defaultMessage: ECCC informs Canadians about protecting and conserving our natural heritage, and ensuring a clean, safe and sustainable environment for present and future generations.
descriptors.description: Department Impact Statement of Environment and Climate Change

descriptors.defaultMessage: Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC) works to improve the standard of living and quality of life for all Canadians. We do this by promoting a labour force that is highly skilled. We also promote an efficient and inclusive labour market.
descriptors.description: Department Impact Statement of Employment and Social Development

descriptors.defaultMessage: Global Affairs Canada manages Canada’s diplomatic relations, provides consular services to Canadians, promotes the country’s international trade, and leads Canada’s international development and humanitarian assistance.
descriptors.description: Department Impact Statement of Global Affairs

descriptors.defaultMessage: The Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) facilitates the flow of legitimate travellers and trade. The Agency also enforces more than 90 acts and regulations that keep our country and Canadians safe.
descriptors.description: Department Impact Statement of Boarder Services Agency

descriptors.defaultMessage: Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada (ISED) works with Canadians in all areas of the economy and in all parts of the country to improve conditions for investment, enhance Canada's innovation performance, increase Canada's share of global trade and build a fair, efficient and competitive marketplace.
descriptors.description: Department Impact Statement of Innovation, Science and Economic Development

descriptors.defaultMessage: Public Services and Procurement Canada serves federal departments and agencies as their central purchasing agent, real property manager, treasurer, accountant, pay and pension administrator, integrity adviser and linguistic authority.
descriptors.description: Department Impact Statement of Public Service and Procurement

descriptors.defaultMessage: The Department of National Defence and the Canadian Armed Forces implement government decisions concerning the defence of Canadians’ interests at home and abroad.
descriptors.description: Department Impact Statement of Department National Defence

descriptors.defaultMessage: Shared Services Canada (SSC) delivers digital services to Government of Canada organizations. We provide modern, secure and reliable IT services so federal organizations can deliver digital programs and services that meet Canadians needs.
descriptors.description: Department Impact Statement of Shared Services Canada

descriptors.defaultMessage: Health Canada is responsible for helping Canadians maintain and improve their health. It ensures that high-quality health services are accessible, and works to reduce health risks.
descriptors.description: Department Impact Statement of Shared Services Canada
Header of Job Poster Builder Impact Step

descriptors.defaultMessage: Working in the federal government offers an important opportunity to have a broad impact for Canadians.
descriptors.description: Bullet Point on Job Poster Builder Impact Step

descriptors.defaultMessage: This is your chance to highlight what makes your work valuable and interesting.
descriptors.description: Bullet Point on Job Poster Builder Impact Step

descriptors.defaultMessage: Your impact statement is the first thing that applicants will see when they click your job poster so make sure it counts!

Header message displayed on the remote work group input.

descriptors.defaultMessage: Want the best talent in Canada? You increase your chances when you allow those in other parts of Canada to apply. Regional diversity also adds perspective to your team culture. Make sure to discuss this in advance with your HR Advisor.
descriptors.description: Body message displayed on the remote work group input.
Header message displayed on the telework group input.

descriptors.defaultMessage: Demonstrate that you trust your employees and you have a positive workplace culture. Allow telework as an option.
descriptors.description: Body message displayed on the telework group input.

descriptors.defaultMessage: How often are flexible hours allowed?
descriptors.description: Header message displayed on the flex hours group input.

descriptors.defaultMessage:
Want to support a more gender inclusive workplace?
                          Studies show allowing flex hours is a great way to improve opportunities for women and parents.
descriptors.description: Body message displayed on the flex hours group input.

descriptors.defaultMessage: You have the ability to accomplish basic tasks with steady supervision and clear direction. The tasks you’re assigned are clear and don’t involve significant complexity. Their impact is usually locally felt. As you advance in this category, you should be developing the ability to accomplish tasks of moderate complexity with steady supervision. You will also need to be able to accomplish basic tasks with little or no supervision. This level is usually associated with tasks that form the bulk of the work for lower level positions, such as junior analysts or entry level developers.
descriptors.description: Description of basic hard skill level.

descriptors.defaultMessage: You have the ability to accomplish tasks of moderate complexity or moderate impact with supervision.The approach to the tasks, and how they are delivered, is determined by the supervisor.You contribute input and advice.You are able to advance the task, even in the face of small to moderate hurdles and complications. As you advance in this category, you should be developing the ability to accomplish tasks of significant complexity or larger impact with steady supervision. You will also need to be able to accomplish tasks of moderate complexity or impact with little or no supervision. This level is usually associated with tasks that form the bulk of the work for mid-level positions, such as analysts or developers.
descriptors.description: Description of intermediate skill level.

descriptors.defaultMessage: You have the ability to accomplish tasks of significant complexity or impact with supervision.You provide advice and input on the approach to the tasks, and how they are delivered, for the supervisor’s consideration. You are able to advance the task, even in the face of moderate to large hurdles and complications. As you advance in this category, you should be developing the ability to accomplish tasks of significant complexity or larger impact with only light levels of supervision, where you are effectively the lead on the initiative. You may also take on a role of training others in this skills set or take on a light supervisory role for those at lower levels. This level is usually associated with tasks that form the bulk of the work for higher level positions, such as senior analysts or senior developers.
descriptors.description: Description of advanced hard skill level.

descriptors.defaultMessage: You have the ability to accomplish tasks of significant complexity or impact, where you call the shots and answer to the organization’s senior management for your decisions. You bring forward the tasks, the approach and the delivery plan for senior management consideration. You often supervise others (individuals or teams) in delivering tasks of high complexity or system wide impact. You are able to advance these tasks, even in the face of significant unforeseen hurdles and complications. As you advance in this category, you should be developing the ability to assess others at more junior levels, becoming able to clearly identify the difference between beginner, intermediate and advanced tasks. You should be able to build teams, set direction and provide supervision. This level is usually associated with tasks that form the bulk of the work for management and executive level positions.
descriptors.description: Description of expert hard skill level.

descriptors.defaultMessage: You’re working on acquiring this skill or attribute. You are able to demonstrate it under favourable conditions (low stress, minimal difficulty) and can apply it in a work context intermittently.
descriptors.description: Description of soft basic skill level.

descriptors.defaultMessage: You’re able to consistently demonstrate this skill or attribute in the workplace, including under conditions of low-to-moderate stress or difficulty. Your peers and supervisors are able to attest to the fact that you have been able to demonstrate this skill or attribute on a regular basis.
descriptors.description: Description of soft intermediate skill level.

descriptors.defaultMessage: You’re able to consistently demonstrate this skill or attribute in the workplace, including under conditions of high stress or difficulty. Your peers and supervisors recognize this as a strength you demonstrate in the workplace.
descriptors.description: Description of soft advanced skill level.

descriptors.defaultMessage: This is a foundational part of who you are. You consistently demonstrate this skill or attribute, even under conditions of extreme stress or difficulty. Your peers and supervisors recognize this as a significant strength you demonstrate in the workplace, providing an example to others.
descriptors.description: Description of expert soft skill level.
Single-word descriptor of basic hard skill level.
Single-word descriptor of intermediate hard skill level.
Single-word descriptor of advanced hard skill level.
Single-word descriptor of expert hard skill level.
Single-word descriptor of soft basic skill level.
Single-word descriptor of soft intermediate skill level.
Single-word descriptor of soft advanced skill level.
Single-word descriptor of soft expert skill level.

descriptors.defaultMessage: This is a description requested during the application process, in which applicants to self-identify and describe their experience and level of expertise with a skill.
descriptors.description: Description of an assessment type, to help a manager understand when to use it.

descriptors.defaultMessage: These questions appear in the application form, and are submitted through Talent Cloud, they allow a first glance at the applicant’s understanding, process, knowledge, or cultural fit for the position.
descriptors.description: Description of an assessment type, to help a manager understand when to use it.

descriptors.defaultMessage: Applicants perform this test in real-time in conjunction with other applicants, team members, or facilitators, to determine their skill prowess, team communication, and performance in a collaborative environment.
descriptors.description: Description of an assessment type, to help a manager understand when to use it.

descriptors.defaultMessage: A loose structure chat between a member of the hiring board and an applicant, aimed at discovering the applicant’s knowledge, aptitudes, or personality traits, conversations may vary between applicants.
descriptors.description: Description of an assessment type, to help a manager understand when to use it.

descriptors.defaultMessage: A formal question-and-answer examination performed in real-time between the hiring-board and an applicant, questions are aimed at assessing skill expertise, level, and approach. Each question is crafted beforehand and follows the same structure between all interviewed applicants.
descriptors.description: Description of an assessment type, to help a manager understand when to use it.

descriptors.defaultMessage: Prepared examination that does not require supervision, and can be performed from any location through internet access, with a defined time-frame for completion.
descriptors.description: Description of an assessment type, to help a manager understand when to use it.

descriptors.defaultMessage: Prepared examination that requires the applicant to perform a test at a specific location under supervision, aimed at assessing skill expertise and technique.
descriptors.description: Description of an assessment type, to help a manager understand when to use it.

descriptors.defaultMessage: Applicants receive a physical package containing the assessment tools, they complete the assessment at their own leisure and at their preferred location without supervision, and must return the materials before a specific deadline.
descriptors.description: Description of an assessment type, to help a manager understand when to use it.

descriptors.defaultMessage: During the application process, applicants provide access to samples of their work to exhibit their skill level, and back-up their skill claims.
descriptors.description: Description of an assessment type, to help a manager understand when to use it.

descriptors.defaultMessage: During the application process, applicants provide contact information to an acquaintance who can validate and confirm their skill expertise, knowledge or aptitude.
descriptors.description: Description of an assessment type, to help a manager understand when to use it.

descriptors.defaultMessage: Test involving the use of games to explore a candidate’s communication skills, resilience, emotional intelligence, among many other soft skills.
descriptors.description: Description of an assessment type, to help a manager understand when to use it.

descriptors.defaultMessage: Narrative Review of skill includes all descriptions added by the applicant in their application.
descriptors.description: Description which replaces 'interview question' for the Narrative Review assessment type.

descriptors.defaultMessage: The provided description contains sufficient evidence to advance this candidate to the next screening steps.
descriptors.description: Standard evalutation statement which replaces 'expected answer' for all skills under the Narrative Review assessment type.

descriptors.defaultMessage: Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada
